messages.subject: Re: Patterns Book?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Sandra also talked recently about pattern *blocks*, after which I went straight on to Amazon and ordered some. Could it be pattern blocks you re
messages.messageBody:
--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, "lukesmama2003" <karenandjoe2@...> wrote:
>
> Hello. I recall reading just a few days ago about a pattern/shape type workbook that Sandra recommended? I think it was with regard to picking up interesting curriculum type books from a teacher's supply store. I can't find it anywhere now and I have decided to stop trying to look. I would rather be playing with my kids. ;-)
>
> I think I have seen Sandra mention this particular workbook more than once so I was curious what it was. I am only interested in picking it up to strew and see if my guys are into it. My oldest (6.5) likes puzzles like the Think Fun games and Suduko. . .
>
> Can someone let me know what the name of it is?
>
> Thanks!
> Karen
>



Sandra also talked recently about pattern *blocks*, after which I went straight on to Amazon and ordered some.

Could it be pattern blocks you're remembering?

Alison

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Patterns Book?
messages.msgSnippet: -=-I think I have seen Sandra mention this particular workbook more than once so I was curious what it was.-=- I think I was just talking about any old
messages.messageBody:
-=-I think I have seen Sandra mention this particular workbook more
than once so I was curious what it was.-=-

I think I was just talking about any old workbooks that look good to
the kid. But I've talked about geoboards sometimes. There are
workbooks to go with them.

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Patterns Book?
messages.msgSnippet: Hello.  I recall reading just a few days ago about a pattern/shape type workbook that Sandra recommended?  I think it was with regard to picking up interesting
messages.messageBody:
Hello. I recall reading just a few days ago about a pattern/shape type workbook that Sandra recommended? I think it was with regard to picking up interesting curriculum type books from a teacher's supply store. I can't find it anywhere now and I have decided to stop trying to look. I would rather be playing with my kids. ;-)

I think I have seen Sandra mention this particular workbook more than once so I was curious what it was. I am only interested in picking it up to strew and see if my guys are into it. My oldest (6.5) likes puzzles like the Think Fun games and Suduko. . .

Can someone let me know what the name of it is?

Thanks!
Karen
